content: the bestie beanie by adler j crafts the bestie beanie is a cable stitch hat knitted in the round a 1x1 rib is worked to create a stretchy brim after which twists and braids alternate with a basket-weave pattern on either side of the decorative front panel the name comes from the fact that this was designed as a christmas present for a friend you will need 105 yards of worsted weight yarn abbreviations used here-caron simply soft in 2/2 rc- hold 2 back on cn k2 k2 from cn burgundy 2/2 lc- hold 2 front on cn k2 k2 from cn 3 75 mm us 5 dpns 2/2 rpc- hold 2 back on cn k2 p2 from cn 4 5 mm us 7 dpns 2/2 lpc- hold 2 front on cn p2 k2 from cn cable needle 2/1 rpc- hold 1 back on cn k2 p1 from cn yarn needle 2/1 lpc- hold 2 front on cn p1 k2 from cn gauge sizing one repeat of the front panel / chart this hat is made to fit a 23 head the b 24 stitches x 16 row will best way to change the sizing if measure 3 5 x 2 needed is to increase/reduce your cast on in sets of 4 adding/taking away 2 each from mirroring basket- weave sections pattern instructions 1 co 90 with the smaller dpns with 33 on n1 24 on n2 and 33 on n3 joining to work in the round ribbing *k1 p1* repeat * to end of row continue this 1x1 rib until work from co measures 4 or longer if you d prefer a wider brim body right twist basket-weave braid front panel cable left twist switch to larger size needles set up row
